Reviews.Title: “Service was awful expect a bed and toilet and nothing more”
Reviews.Author: BrianT88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was a great location and the price was cheap. We expected a decent but small room with its own toilet / shower. Instead we arrived to find out we were "Upgraded" to the Suite. At first this seemed like a plesant suprise until they told us the suite was located in another neighbourhood. The room was better than expected, but again we booked soley based on the location and this new location was about a 30 minute walk from the hotel. At first we were thrilled to be located so close to Sacre Cour but then it turned out to be quite a hassle as the nearest metro station is a 15 minute walk and an extra metro ticket each way through the funicular (for those who cant manage the 10 flights of stairs down the hill). We did find that there was lots to see and do in the new area but again we were dissapointed in the unexpected additional costs of getting to and from the metro (The original hotel rooms are a 2 minute walk). The service at the hotel was unacceptable when 5 days into the trip we realized that no one was going to come supply clean linens / additional toiletries. Call after call warranted a response of "We will send someone tomorrow" and no one ever came 3 days in a row. Eventually they stopped speaking with us and when asked about fresh sheets and clean towels they hung up on us. We call our travel provider to get them involved and when they contacted the hotel their staff members came by and made the bed and took out the trash. No new towels, No additional toilet paper. No new soap. No fresh sheets. The response we got was "Come pick them up yourselves" which wouldnt be so bad if it wasnt a 30 minute walk or a 10 euro metro trip to go get. It wouldnt have been an issue if we were in the hotel as I am more than capable of going to a front desk to pick up my own stuff if need be. The end result was we had to buy our own toiletries and launder our own linens. Had we known in advance of the change of location we could have packed appropriately and none of this woudl have been an issue, but because of the no advanced notice and the lack of ANY willingnes to help / comprimise on the hotels part, I would say 2 Stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel montmartre”
Reviews.Author: barney2
Reviews.Content: good hotel for what you are paying , if you want 4* this isnt the place for you but if you want cheap accomodation there is no better for where it is , great position just yards from the place de clichy tube , close to the sacre couer and other tourist destinations

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but you can see it.”
Reviews.Author: SariBee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good location. It is close to many metro stations. The hotel is not in good shape, the paint is pealing from walls and roof. The room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Juliana M
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights.Location and the service was excellent.the staff was very friendly and Thomas,in front deck speak very good english and friendly.room was very small in comparison to USA &Canadian motels and hotels..Bed was damp,but clean.sheets,towels was changed and room cleaned every day.Breakfast was small,but good enough with the good coffee.you could hear noise from the street& hall ways,but we were so tired from lots of walking, so I plugged my ears with ear plug and had good sleep.I would stay again in this hotel due to location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small, simple and cheap”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaN
Reviews.Content: We stay 4 nights in november 2011 when is outside the tourist seson and maybe for these reason it was cheap ( about 220 euro for 4 nights).The hotel is near to 2 metro station :Clichy and Pigalle, and in the neighborhood is manny place to eat.The hotel is very simple, the room it was small,clean and almost quiet.The staff it was verry nice.The breakfast it was not enough for me and my husband, it was a french breakfast :croissant, horns, butter,jam, juice, coffee, tea. The location is not to good for family with children because is to close to "red zone" with manny sex shops and in the evening is too manny strange people (like black showing like bandits).Neighborhood (District Montamarte) is famous for its picturesque and bohemian life here and Sacre Coeur is not to far to Hotel (Sacre Coeur is wonderful in the evening light).

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Gurtol
Reviews.Content: If I go to paris again this is the place I'll stay at. Hotel is nothing special, the elevator was kinda dangerous and slow, I used the stairs a few times. the room didn't have any ac, but this was in september so no problem. small breakfast but enough. when I travel i spend so little time in the room. but the included breakfast is something I really need, even if it's not that big buffé.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small and simple”
Reviews.Author: LincolnC
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel, a great location 200m from Moulin Rouge, the rooms and hotel is clean and simple. Great value for the price and the staff are very friendly. Downsides - shower not very big, the door had a gap round the edge meaning you could hear the other guest coming back. But if you want simple and cheap then this is a good option. If you want a late night drink near by then the irish bar is option until 5am (100m walk) and nice pizza place near the cinema.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose...”
Reviews.Author: Just_Starving
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Montmartre for 3 days with some friends. When you are only in Paris for 3 days, the quality of your hotel is pretty much irrelevant. It was a place to sleep and recharge with Moulin Rouge, the famous Pigalle district, le Bistrot Chat Noire, Sacre Coeur and the metro stations all within a 5 minute walk max... Like many old buildings in the area the rooms are small and not well ventilated, and since the building was constructed before electricity, there is no elevator. The breakfast consists of substandard coffee OJ, croissants, baguette and jam... The service at the desk was good but it was strange that there was only one key given per room and you have to leave it at the desk when you go out... Overall I rate this hotel average. It was a place to put my head down a few hours a night for 3 nights. If you're in Paris for the full experience and not looking to spend a lot of time in your room, this is a good place because of its (relatively) low room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch plus a dishonest concierge”
Reviews.Author: aeroneer
Reviews.Content: Be careful what you will get when you think that you have got a great deal with this hotel with great rate at a better location who might employ a bait and switch tactic to redirect you to another hotel at an inferior location with worse room facility. I booked two rooms for one night with the Modern Hotel (3 Rue Forest, Paris, 75018, France, telephone +33143874761) in Paris, France on 3/31/11 back in February 2011. The hotel is conveniently located near the metro station Place de Clichy. However, upon arrival around 19:00. We were told by the concierge that the rooms we had reserved and had been confirmed by Hotels.com were not available. Instead, we were told by the concierge/receptionist to walk to another hotel New Montmatre which is one of several hotels owned by a group of oversea investors. He gave us the directions and told us the new hotel is only 7 minutes walking distance. However, following his directions and with the help of a good Samaritan, it took us nearly a hour to walk there on foot dragging the luggage while negotiating with traffic and steep hilly terrain. The new hotel is located on a steep hill next to the Basilique du Sacred Coeur and is 3 metro stops (Anvers) away from the original hotel (Place de Clichy). The entire course is a huge uphill climb. We were exhausted when we finally got the other hotel and it ruined our original plan to go to see Eiffel Tower that night. We had to climb 82 steps and walk several city blocks to reach the nearest metro station (Anvers) The rooms in the hotel New Montmatre are worse than we expected. The TV in one room is missing and the TV in the other room does not work at all. It was hot in the room and air was stuffy. The windows face a dirty small courtyard so we did not want to open.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but more hostel than hotel”
Reviews.Author: tash0201
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Modern Hotel and were a little disappointed. We asked to move rooms when we first arrived as the first room we were put into was tiny, dark and on the 5th floor and generally 'tired'. The second room was slightly better - bigger and a bigger bathroom with a bath as well as a shower, however, the TV in our room didn't work - and repeated requests to get it fixed or swapped were ignored. Hairdryers are available, but only on request and be prepared to leave a 20Euro deposit. They advertise a bar, but it was not open the whole time we were there and while breakfast is satisfactory, make sure you get down early as it just sits out and the coffee stews a bit! The biggest problem, though, is the noise. There is absolutely no soundproofing in this hotel, so beware - you can hear everything in your neighbours room!!! Conversations, bathroom activities....everything!! And they can hear you too!! Rooms wre cleaned daily, though and for location, this hotel is very good. It also has a (very small) lift.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: New_York_10003
Reviews.Content: I had reservations for The Modern Hotel at 3 rue Forest, 75018 Paris, France, for myself and my young son. When we arrived after our flight from Hamburg, we were informed that there was an “emergency” and would have to spend the first night at a less desirable hotel in a less desirable location and not show up again at The Modern Hotel until 2:00 PM the following day (thus ruining the following day’s plans). The “emergency,” of course, according to our travel agent, is that The Modern Hotel had intentionally overbooked and sent us…the unlucky, prepaid patrons…to the Hotel Montmartrois, a classic “bait and switch.” The Hotel Montmartrois was truly a lesser hotel…little more than a hostel…yet we were offered neither a total nor a partial refund. I strongly suggest that you verify the availability of your room prior to arrival. The Modern Hotel management appears to be somewhat lacking in both ethics and professionalism. Since we were tourists, the management no doubt rightly assumed that we were limited in our ability to respond in an effective manner (short of beating up the clerk at the main desk). I would avoid this place if I were you. I’ll certainly never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bags”
Reviews.Author: lidia789
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Modern hotel 2 nights. On the first night we noticed that we had bed bags in our beds. The guy at the reception desk said that this is normal in Paris, and can't do nothing about it. We got another room next day, this time without bed bags. If you don't mind getting few bites, it is in a good location, quite clean, and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Chancers!”
Reviews.Author: macy131
Reviews.Content: The modern Hotel is actually not a bad place to stay if you are on a budget. You get a basic room with a nice comfy bed and an en suite showeroom (very small but convenient). The location of the hotel is also very good and close to metro stations. I was quite happy with my stay at this hotel until a few weeks after I returned to the UK, looked at my bank statement and noticed that the hotel had charged my debit card €129.60 for no reason. I had booked and paid for the holiday (flights and hotel) with Expedia before I went. When we checked-in, the guy at reception asked for my card details in case I used any additional room services which would be charged to my card. We did not use any additional room services (there wasn’t much in the hotel room to use tbh)! I rang the hotel straight away to ask why my card had been charged this extra amount, and was told someone would ring me back. After several emails and phone calls, I finally spoke to the manager who informed me that a “huge mistake” had been made and a refund would be given. Eventually, after more phone calls and emails and several weeks later, I got a refund, but lost out on around £6, because I was charged £2.99 commission when they took the money off my debit card, and I was again charged commission when they refunded the money. This additional charge I did not get back even though I asked for it. Like I said – a great hotel if you are on a budget, but we wary of giving them your card details when you check-in as you might get a shock later!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay if you're not fussy.”
Reviews.Author: winkpc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find and is located midway between two Metro stations in one of the busier parts of Paris.. I stayed there for one night before joining a tour group at another Paris hotel. The rate included a decnt breakkfast and I thought the place was a good value since is cost about $100. If you're traveling together as a couple, bear in mind that these accomodations are small and not very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Barely better than a Hostel but on as safe.”
Reviews.Author: A_E2010
Reviews.Content: True this hotel has a great location next to the metro and is a short walking distance to many attractions and did have an all be it small private bath. But this place was nasty in the heat. We stayed in July during a hot spell. The rooms have no air conditioning, doors barley lock, We were woken up by our neighbors each morning though no fault of theirs but due to the paper thin walls. Room either overlook a noisy street or a courtyard where open trash was dieing on the cement stewing in the sun. Both the lift and the stairs felt as though they would give out underneath. WINDOWS EXTREMELY DANGEROUS FOR CHILDREN. SPEND THE EXTRA MONEY AND STAY ELSEWHERE. NOT WORTH IT EVEN FOR A TWO STAR.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty and expensive (considering the shabby quality).”
Reviews.Author: travelosaurus
Reviews.Content: I travel about 20 days a month and have become quite savvy about knowing what to expect from a hotel considering it's price, location and quality - and this is probably the worst I've ever seen. Because of the high marks from other reviewers, my girlfriend and I decided to stay here for her birthday. We walked in at 1pm to check in (the Hotels.com check-in time) and were told that check-in was 2pm. Usually not a problem, but after a 20 hour travel day, it was disappointing. The hotel also lists wi-fi as a feature, but it's not in the room, it's only in a dirty little 10'x10' makeshift "lobby" with ratty couches and a dozen other people people stading around trying to use the internet. We got to the room and it was so disgusting (threadbare sheets, a 6" "balcony" featuring a festering rain gutter and overlooking rape-alley, no secondary lock, and a door that seems to have been kicked-in regularly [I opened it with a credit card, and ANY thief could easily do the same. And this is NOT a safe neighborhood. It was difficult to feel safe enough to sleep here], a floor so uneven that our luggage wouldn't stand upright), that we walked out immediately. The fellow at the desk said that there are no refunds, that we will never see our money. We were exhausted, so we sucked it up and stayed. The included "breakfast" were two pieces of bread, coffee, and some jelly. Though one expects at least some cheese, or yogurt, or muesli from a European continental breakfast. We left disappointed, tired and hungry. I recommend spending an extra couple euro and staying somewhere safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location, nice staff, clean ))”
Reviews.Author: NikitinaJane
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. The perfect location. All sights are within walking distance. Rather a quiet place. Good staff, good breakfast. Comfortable bed, just what you need after a day of sightseeing. the downsides - poor sound insulation. But if you're tired - it does not matter

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Galvo1
Reviews.Content: As we walked in the front desk person barely acknowledged us while on the phone. After a minute he put a form to complete in front of us whist still chatting. Other than that first impression, the service was quite pleasant and breakfast was good. excellent location, close to the Metro. No fridge in the room, but the tiny balcony outsdie the window kept the drinkls cold.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP N CHEERFUL, GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: scottishlassie64
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for a long weekend with my boyfriend to get engaged in September. we chose this hotel for 3 reasons, cost, location and mainly the fact that it had an EN SUITE BATHROOM, as most cheaper Paris hotels dont. the shower was one of the best, strongest, I have ever used. a real POWER SHOWER. We loved it. although it was in a shower cabinet about 6 inches off floor and we had to step up into it and at same time physically twist round to get in through the doors of it. the bed was very comfortable indeed. it was quiet a peaceful quiet street, with a small alleyway running past our ground floor room, so very little traffic noise. the hotel is near the end of the street, near to the busy Boluevard De Clichy. handy for bus routes, including one of the 4 open top bus tours. 29 euros for a 2 day ticket, which you would need, as there are 4 different routes and so much to see. TOO MUCH FOR ONE DAY. HOTEL STAFF were friendly, and most spoke good English, were good with directions. there were lots of restaurants nearby. Most open till late at night. we arrived after 10.30pm and had our first meal at 11.45pm. Tthere was a lovely Italian Restaurant, I dont remember the name of it, but was near Mcdonalds and KFC. WE WERE VERY CLOSE TO THE MOULIN ROUGE, so much so we passed it every day, and our first sight as we left the hotel each morning was the long queues of people, round the block, presumably buying tickets for the evening performances. also, close to the SACRE COUER, 15 minutes walk., where we spent a whole day, enjoying the sunshine, the views, and just people watching. we walked through the Montremarte area, which was lovely, all little cafes. we visited the cemetery where the ballet dancer Nijinsky is buried. never found his grave,the cemetery is vast, but i did notice some other tourists had maps! a tranquil place to spent some time. finally, after we got engaged, we hired a private Citroen 2CV and driver for 1 hour in the evening, as advertised in open top bus tour leaflet, to see the sights by night. Something a little bit different, and memorable. Our driver, KARL, was 21, a medical student, and very informative. he took lots of photos of the 2 of us outside Eiffel Tower and other landmarks. All in all, a lovely 4 days, but it is very, very expensive to eat out in Paris

Reviews.Title: “more than u'll except from 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: judjemental
Reviews.Content: I've been there with my mum for her b-day. the hotel have a great location few metro stops from garu de nord, 15 mins walk to montmartre, and 1 min away from moulin rouge. The hotel is clean, rooms are o.k (enough for 1 night stay after you've walked all day), although walls are realy thin so we could hear next door singing in the shower. Great breakfast you can get coffee/tea, juice a baggutte and crosionat, even some yugurts and selection of jams. Quite ideal to fill you up for the day as everything is paris is sooooooooo EXPENSIVE! Our train was leaving at 8:00 pm so we left our laugage in the hotel, left for the day and picked it up at 6:00 pm. All staff friendly and welcoming definitely good bargain for a 2 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good value”
Reviews.Author: nimen_hao
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception staff and breakfast servers. We got breakfast included which was a fantastic idea - croissants, baguettes, jam, butter, tea, coffee, and orange juice in a bright front room every morning. Our double twin room was spacious enough with windows that opened fully letting in the fresh breeze, and our room was always made spic and span each day by housekeeping. Our only complaint would be that you have to give your hotel key back when you leave each day, and that appears to be the only key (as we discovered from an angry housekeeping when we kept it with us one day). But the front desk was staffed 24/7 so getting your key was easy whenever you returned. Great location, close to metro, on side street, tons of cafes nearby, and about 2 blocks from Moulin Rouge. Our shower stall was a bit small, which is common in Paris, but a bigger (i.e., wider, not taller) person might not be able to squeeze in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - but clean and adequate.”
Reviews.Author: bigfoody
Reviews.Content: This is fine if all you want is somewhere to crash out after a tiring day in Paris. The sheets and towels are changed daily. The tiny en suite is OK - a decent hot shower. Breakfast was fine - basic continental fare. Staff were friendly. We were allowed to leave our luggage at the hotel for several hours after checking out, which freed us up to do more sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “can you find a better room in Paris with 50euros for a 3 night-offer???”
Reviews.Author: sunshine_29480
Reviews.Content: The Modern Hotel is a very simple hotel. No luxuries, at all...but for someone who is not too into the "room" thing, meaning he doesn't care much for the accommodation details -except of course for the cleanliness- is pretty good. Personally, as long as there is a clean bathroom and clean sheets i 'm fine...since we spent most of the day wondering around paris... So to sum it up...pretty good for young people whose purpose is to explore Paris till the last minute..

Reviews.Title: “A decent low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ale3andro
Reviews.Content: We wanted a decent low budget hotel for our trip to Paris and ended up booking this for 3 nights. It's a decent hotel but not great. It is ideal for low budget (young) Paris visitors. It is located near the metro station of Place de Clichy, it is very close to the Moulin Rouge and relatively close to Monmartre's Sacre Coeur. The room was small, the bathroom too (but at least it was a private one). The first night we realized that the room service left no towels! Nevertheless they gave us towels upon request. If you have more money to spend for accommodation then stay some place else but if you are on a low budget trip consider this one.

Reviews.Title: “They have bedbugs in rooms”
Reviews.Author: PolskaPoland
Reviews.Content: They have bedbugs in rooms. Room service broke my glas of parfume. The shower in bathtrooms was full of holes. TV set was very loud and can't sound down it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Krissy53
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in. The hotel did not have wardrobes to hang your clothes. We were told to use the TV bracket!. The lounge area/bar does NOT exist as this is now the breakfast room. Breakfast consists of one piece of bread and one croissant with tea or coffee and orange juice. The spiral staircase to the upper floors has loose stairtreads and carpet, very dangerous. Hotel security is non existent. We went out sightseeing and the maid left our room unlocked on several occassions. The toilet was falling off the wall and the only way to stop it moving was put 4 beer mats under the pedestal. The views were awful, derelict buildings opp. Lots and lots of street beggars. Hotel night time noise could be compared to a knocking shop which went on for several hours. Only stay here if you are desparate and want to be close to the M. Rouge. The only good thing about the hotel was it was close to Sacre Couer and near some very nice restaurants. Overall I would NOT stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: nspnick
Reviews.Content: Despite booking in May (4 months previous) and paying in full well in advance we arrived to find there was no availability and had been moved to another hotel at least 3 metro stops away. First time in Paris we were given a poorly photocopied map and told it was a 10 minute walk and no they wouldn't pay for a taxi. The receptionist was incredibly rude and this was only matched by her complete lack of interest in our situation. In my opinion this hotel is a disgrace to all things French and should be shut down I strongly recomend you book anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: LaPeel
Reviews.Content: I was surprised after reading a bad review of this hotel in Spanish, by Sandra. It was actually a lot better than we were expecting. It s a 2 stars hotel, but superbly located, a block from the Moulin Rouge and the turist little trains to the Sacre Coure and the Montmartre market square, also one only has to cross the road from the hotel (in a side road from the boulevards) to find the metro and buses. As a matter of fact, we only had to take a taxi once, after the Eiffel Tower at night, all other we did on buses , considering that I am disabled (or have mobility impairments) this is a great thing. The decoration isnt probably the most uptodate thing, is simple and a bit run down, the lift is a bit small, but considering what we paid for it, I would say is a great deal, at least in our case, we go to be out and about, and it was still a very nice feeling to come back to the hotel at night. The staff made us feel very welcomed, treated us marvelously , maybe that had a bit to do with the fact that I (though studied a long time ago) tried to speak French as much as I could.....but the concierge spoke good English. I took my mum and my daughter and a friend met us there from Spain, we were all very happy with the hotel in general. The bathrooms were a bit run down but clean, and the shower was marvelous. My main concern before travelling was that we went mid winter , but the central heating was fantastic. We had no trouble at all. Simple, no luxury, but very good prices and location. I would love to go back there in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain...”
Reviews.Author: Rodie
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking forward to my stay here after reading the last few reviews. However, having only paid £45 per night for a double room with breakfast, what could I expect? The location was good - minutes from the Place de Clichy Metro, where you can get into the centre easily, walking distance to the lovely Montmarte district and the Sacre Couer, and plenty of eateries and bars in the vicinity. The room was clean, if basic, and towels and sheets changed daily. The breakfast was the usual croissant, bread, jam and yogurt with good coffee and orange juice - nothing more or less than what the cafe's serve up. Two people with cases could get in the lift and we never had to queue for the lift. OK, some traffic noise (we were 2nd floor rear) but I'm sure this would have been more pronounced in central Paris and it didn't stop us sleeping well after walking Paris by day. The staff were helpful and we checked in at 12 as our room was ready and they kept our cases until 6pm on the day of departure. Considering we recently paid £80 per night in York, England for something on the same lines, I don't see why anyone can complain.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Billytheseal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for about 30 ninutes. The room was dark and depressing. The door had clarly been kicked in and had been repaired cheaply. The smell was bad so we left and found a better place 5 minutes down the road. I have complained to Thomas Cook. There's nothing positive to say apart from the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Run with mice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend planned to stay in this hotel for two nights. When we arrived we were located to our room which was on the top floor so we had to take the lift which only fitted one person in at a time without bags. When we eventually got in our room the floor was un-level and if you put things on the table they rolled off. Straight away we left the hotel to tour paris because we couldnt stay there any longer. when we went back to the hotel to sleep my boyfriend spotted a mouse running from under the bed into a hole behind the toilet in the bathroom. we went to complain to the manager and asked if we could move rooms but there was no other rooms available so we had to search paris with our bags to find another hotel. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone as it made our holiday a complete nighmare !

Reviews.Title: “skank hellhole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my sisters passport went missing in our room durin our stay here and the staff refused to help us to find a police station to report this, they shouted at us and basically said they dont care, all i wanted from them was to assist us in finding the nearest police station as our french was too basic. in the end we had to walk at 1am in the morning thru a dangerous part of Paris. (the restaurant that we dined at earlier that night helped us in the end) what an awful way to end our trip. what a mean hotel! STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “A very unmodern hotel”
Reviews.Author: OVNezzy
Reviews.Content: This looked more like a doss house then a two star hotel. How any respectable tour opperator (Thomas Cook please note) can recommend this hotel to their customers is beyond me. The only good point for this hotel is it was clean, so if on a short trip to Paris you will most likely only be sleeping there as it has nothing else to offer. The life was out of order, so this meant and eighty winding stair climb to the fourth floor with no offer of luggage assistance for disabled ect. The emergency arrangements also leave a lot to be desired. I could not find any way out incase of fire other then the main stairs, and since we did have the fire alarm go off at 0530hrs, this was the only way out. The fire instructions informed us that should the fire be on the stairs then we should return to our rooms, close the door, go to the window and seek attention from there!!

HotelInfo.Name: The Modern Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3 rue Forest, 75018 Paris, France
